body.name: TP-Link Tapo 2K Indoor Security Camera for Baby Monitor, Dog Camera w/ Motion Detection, 2-Way Audio Siren, Night Vision, Cloud & SD Card Storage(Up to 256 GB), Works w/ Alexa & Google Home(Tapo C110)

features: 【2K High Definition】Capture every detail inside your home with crystal-clear 2K high definition video with this indoor security camera. Easily see what your baby is holding or what your pet is playing with.

【Secure Local or Cloud Storage】Save footage continuously on up to a 256 GB microSD card (not included) or subscribe to Tapo Care for cloud storage which saves 30-day video history and provides additional benefits such as Rich Notification, Video Summary and more.

【Detection & Instant Notification】Get instant push notifications when motion, person or baby crying is detected, there is no additional fee to use it as a baby camera monitor. Discern from notifications that matter, so you'll know if its your pet playing around or if someone is actually there.

【Works w/ Alexa & Google Assistant】Fully compatible with Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant, use your simple voice command to view Tapo indoor security camera live stream on Echo Show or Google Chrome Cast with a screen. Easily get your home security footage up on a larger TV display.

【2-Way Audio w/ Built In Siren】Never truly leave home with the built-in 2-way audio. Use as a pet camera with phone app to comfort your pet from anywhere in the world. Keep your family safe with cameras for home security indoor by warding off intruders.
【Night Vision up to 30 Ft.】Never miss a thing that goes on, even at night thanks to the integrated IR system on this indoor camera which provides 30 feet of night vision.

【Device Sharing】View your WiFi camera feed from two different smart phone devices. Now mom and dad can both see what's happening at home with a single camera, making keeping an eye on the little ones just a bit easier.
body.description: With crystal clear 2K HD video, the Tapo C110 Home Security Wi-Fi gives you the ability to always keep an eye on your family, pets, and protect your home. With person and motion detection, get instant notifications that matter when there is activity going on. Also used as a baby camera monitor, Tapo C210 provides free baby crying detection.Check what's inside your home, even at night with night vision thanks to the integrated IR sensor. With device sharing, you and a family member can both monitor the feed making keeping an eye on the little ones just a little bit easier. Record footage continuously onto a 256 GB micro-SD card (not included) or subscribe to Tapo Care for 30-day video history and many other benefits. With crisp 2-way audio, you'll never truly be away again with the ability to hold clear conversations with who's there. Additionally keep your family safe from unwanted intruders by playing the built-in siren and light alarm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really nice indoor security camera! Easy to install and set-up! Really easy to use with the app, and the camera "live" video can be accessed from anywhere, as long as you have a data or WiFi connection. Perfect for watching pets or monitoring children and babies rooms, as well as a security camera! It has great passive infrared and can "see in the dark". You can listen to what's happening, you can talk through the microphone and you can take pictures and video too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple to set up - Sort of
reviews.reviewText: This was my first remote cam so it was a learning experience. Picture is excellent. It's been reliable from day one. This is an entry level camera so it has few features. But that's all I wanted, just a camera to show a fixed view of the inside of the garage and let me know when the door goes up and whether the car is there. Does the job perfectly. Day vision is a very nice picture, night vision is more than adequate. The app for iPad works seamlessly. BUT setting the camera up was a battle of incomplete directions and poorly programmed timing on the camera itself. If you're comfortable with figuring your way through wifi connections and changing networks (you have to switch quickly back and forth between the network of the camera and your home network) then you'll probably get this figured out. If technical things are a challenge - this camera will likely be frustrating. My biggest disappointment is that Tapo doesn't provide an app for PC and that's where I wanted to use it. However, some googling quickly led me to Agent DVR (a free program) which the Tapo will work with. That too was an uphill battle to get it configured correctly, but now I've got it. Agent DVR will also let you add additional cameras which you can view simultaneously. In contrast, the Tapo app for iPad only lets you view one camera at a time (though it's easy to switch between them). Overall, the setup was way more complex than I expected. But now that it's set up, it works exactly as I'd hoped.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good product at decent price.
reviews.reviewText: I own two Tapo cams now. I use them all the time. I now live in a motel, 6 month lease, and it's not the best area. So I bought this one on a different one so they can cover my butt when I leave for shopping or work or whatever. Very easy to set up. Very easy to use the software app. The video quality is excellent and not choppy. But the audio recording and the two-way feature have something for the company to work on. You can understand some of what someone says in the room when it's recording, but that isn't good quality at all. That's my only gripe. After a little research into these type of devices, I find that in most cases, excellent audio doesn't come and tell your head a $90 or above product. And I mean that I seem to hear that about all brand product. I'm not saying that I don't like this product because I do. I very much do. If I was able to get a bigger place, I wouldn't hesitate to buy a couple more of these. They are very small and easy to tuck away.I love the feature that it has for storing the videos, both on a media card and cloud storage. The cloud storage comes with a 30-day trial after which you will have to pay for a month subscription. If you're using these for real security reasons, I would highly recommend to go ahead and get your 30-day subscription that will support multiple items at once. You won't need to have to get a subscription for each one. That way if the place does get robbed, I can only assume that they would snag these cams thinking they would take the evidence with them. The cloud storage stops that. After testing a lot of times what the label is like when I walk into my room as it is secured until my phone receives the alert, sending a photo of the visitor to my phone immediately. Well immediately meeting within 10 seconds sometimes 15 seconds. Well that's good enough for me.I also like the fact that it has the option to activate an alarm as well as motion detection recording. It sounds like the standard alarm clock on your phone. The volume is about the same as a decent phone turned all the way up for alarm. It does in fact echo out into the Hall with my door closed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My neighbor's house was recently broken into and I thought I should take some measures to secure my home a little more. I bought this camera because I wanted something that had local storage and didn't force me to pay a subscription. I was pleasantly surprised by how good of quality this camera is for the price. The Tapo app is easy to navigate and I like the choice of settings. The AI Person detection doesn't always trigger, but the Motion detection will catch them. There's also a Baby Crying sound detection that I haven't tested because, well, no babies here.This camera works perfectly for its intended use for indoors, but I originally bought this thinking I could perch it on the front window sill and aim it through the glass at the front door to deter burglars, see who's knocking on my door, and make the camera harder to steal. This works for the day time, but when night vision turns on (and I haven't found a way to disable this mode) the window screen obstructs the view, so now this camera lives elsewhere.I wish Tapo had a wireless video doorbell that was available in the US (maybe they're working on it), but for now I also have the outdoor camera, as well as the contact sensors to monitor the doors and windows opening. So far I like the system and the price point is a little better than others, especially since cloud storage isn't mandatory (but if you do get it, it's $3.49 a month per device).The only real negative I've experienced is that moving shadows during the day and floating specks of dust at night can set off the motion detection, even on the lowest sensitivity. But probably better to be too sensitive than not enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value and Easy Setup
reviews.reviewText: I bought a pair of these cameras to use in our nursery and I must admit they were easier to setup than I initially thought. Night vision is great and the movement detection zone settings are great to avoid tripping the notification system if a high traffic areas happens to be in frame of the camera.The video quality is great and I love that it has local storage options, especially given how cheap microSD cards have gotten lately.

gran calidad en el producto, estoy muy contento con la adquisición de esta cámara, es justo lo que necesitaba, se conecta fácil, se ve impecable la resolución en mi celular, avisa si detecta movimiento, en la noche se ve excelente. Es para interiores. Muy recomendable y el precio es excelente
Muy buena cámara, me encanta que puedes activar notificaciones de llanto y de movimiento del bebé, la resolución súper bien y se instala muy fácil

Facil de instalar, con imagen clara y facil de manejar con la app que es muy facil de usar. Tiene vision nocturna con buena imagen, microfono y bocina que tambien se escuchan claramente. Las alertas de movimiento funcionan perfecto. Estoy satisfecho con mi compra.
Muy buena cámara , se ve muy bien la imagen, el sonido es bueno y se enlaza sin problema con alexa !!!
